content.title: Janani Shishu Suraksha Karyakram
content.details: A scheme by Ministry of MoHFW for pregnant women who access government health facilities for their delivery. It provides absolutely free and no expense delivery, including caesarean section. Essential care is provided to the mother and her neonate within 48 hours. The scheme was launched in June 2011 to eliminate out-of-pocket expenses for institutional delivery of pregnant women and treatment of sick infants. In 2014, the programme was extended to all antenatal & postnatal complications of pregnancy and similar entitlements have been put in place for all sick newborns and infants (up to one year of age) accessing public health institutions for treatment.
benefits: Free diet during stay in the health institutions
Free transport from home to health institutions
Free transport between facilities in case of referral
Free drop back from Institutions to home after 48hrs stay
Free drugs and consumables for sick newborns
Free provision of blood for sick newborns
Exemption from user charges for sick newborns
Free transport from home to health institutions for sick newborns
Free transport between facilities in case of referral for sick newborns
Free drop back from Institutions to home for sick newborns
eligibility: The applicant must be a pregnant woman.
The applicant must be admitted in a government health facility.
content.application_process: The pregnant woman is referred by the competent staff of the public health facility for JSSK.

faqs.question: What medicines / consumables for a sick newborn provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The complete list of the medicines / consumables can be found in Annexure-II of the scheme guidelines.

faqs.question: Which tests are covered under free diagnostics?
faqs.answer: Blood, Urine Tests and Ultrasonography etc.

faqs.question: For how many days will the pregnant women be provided free diet?
faqs.answer: 3 days for normal delivery and 7 days for C-section.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.

faqs.question: I am expecting twins, am I also eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, you are eligible to avail the benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: I was admitted into the public health facility when I was eight months into pregnancy. Does it in any affect way to my entitlements under this scheme?
faqs.answer: You are equally eligible to receive the benefits in this scheme.
